game.gameObject.graphics

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.gameObject.graphics.Painter
      • game.gameObject.graphics.Camera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameObject, Movable, KeyListener, UpdateListener, java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>

    public class Camera
extends Painter
implements Movable, UpdateListener, KeyListener
    A Camera is the object responsible for looking into a Games scene and painting what it sees.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Julius Häger

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera(GameObjectHandler gameObjectHandeler,
              int x,
              int y,
              int width,
              int height)
        Creates a instance of a Camera object with the specified location, width and height.
        Parameters:
        gameObjectHandeler - - The GameObjectHandler whose content the camera should render.
        x - - The start x-coordinate of the upper most corner of the camera.
        y - - The start x-coordinate of the upper most corner of the camera.
        width - - The width of the Camera viewport (in pixels).
        height - - The height of the Camera viewport (in pixels).

      • update

        public void update(long timeNano)
        Description copied from interface: Movable

        Used to update the movement based on the time passed since the last update.

        Note:
        Should be implemented so that the Dynamic x and y equal to pixels per second.

        Specified by:
        update in interface Movable
        Specified by:
        update in interface UpdateListener
        Parameters:
        timeNano - time since last update (in milliseconds)

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)

        Called to paint to a Graphics2D object.

        Subclasses overriding this method should only update the Painter.paintables list before calling the super method.

        This methods only updates Painter.paintables array when haveObjectsChanged method returns true.

        Overrides:
        paint in class Painter
        Parameters:
        g2d - the Graphics2D object to paint to

      • updateBounds

        public void updateBounds()

        Updates the bounds of the camera.

        The bounds are used to determine what objects to draw.

        Specified by:
        updateBounds in interface GameObject

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
        Returns the GameObject bounds. Used to determine if the GameObjects methods should be called or not.

        The cameras bounds are used to determine what objects to paint.

        Specified by:
        getBounds in interface GameObject
        Returns:
        the GameObject bounds

      • getZOrder

        public int getZOrder()

        A camera object is always at the top of the scene and thus has a value of Integer.MAX_VALUE - 8.

        The z-level is not Integer.MAX_VALUE but 8 less to leave room for other functionality;

        Specified by:
        getZOrder in interface GameObject
        Returns:
        the current Z-Order of the GameObject.
